wpt.name: GCQTTR
wpt.desc: Mickey's Perilous Perch by Angry-Beaver + Miss Meggos, Traditional Cache (2/2)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Mickey's Perilous Perch
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Access to this cache area is easy to find. It is along the Struble Trail but is NOT on county property. NOTE: There is a Letterbox nearby. Make sure you have found the cache not the box for credit.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Be assured that the property from the middle of the trail and up the hillside belongs to my family. Starting at the big jutting rock and past the chain link fence heading towards Downingtown. Enjoy this cache along the quietest part of the Struble Trail. Plenty of places to fish and skp rocks. The cache area is great for people watching. Placed on private property along the Struble Trail this is Tupperware box with a log, pencil and some things of our favorite character and normal cache stuff. It was given a 2 for thick foliage cover and plenty of places to hide and a little climb. The cache is less than 50' from the Struble trail so you do not need to climb to the top searching. Please respect the private property and don't try to climb to the top.

Click to Visit the SEPAG Homepage and Forums

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Found with dawnie22 and our girls. Couldn't get a good signal so we took a roundabout route, but we got there.
